titleStmt.title: James B. White to Beriah Magoffin
CWG9188

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons and Remissions, 1859-1862

body.p:
I was informed a few days Since By Mr Jos F Bell that you was of opinion that you had acted, upon the petition of James T. white my Son, and that you had handed the remittance will with the papers to M J. Fox I saw in Fox he says that you told him that you would remit the Bail Bond of $200 in the Glasgow circuit court but that you did not hand them to him Mr Bell informed me that if you had not hand the papers to you would
yet attend to it
Sir will you do me the favour of remitting me the papers which will be received with the highest esteem and regard
